verse: When Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he did not go to seek omens as he did before, but rather faced the wilderness.
Balaam raised his eyes and he saw Israel camped tribe by tribe. The Spirit of God came upon him
and he took up his oracle:
Balak became enraged at Balaam. Balak clasped his hands together and said to Balaam, “I summoned you to curse my enemies, but you have blessed them these three times.
Now then, leave and go home. I told you that I would reward you richly, but the Lord has kept you from being paid.”
But Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not tell your messengers who sent for me,
‘If Balak were to give me a house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the word of the Lord on my own either for good or for bad. Whatever the Lord proclaims, that I must speak!’
Now I am going back to my own people; come, allow me to let you know what this people will do to your people in the future.”
Balaam’s Fourth Oracle. So he took up the oracle and said,
He looked upon the Kenites and took up his oracle and said,
Then Balaam got up and went home, and Balak also went his way.
